page.title: 09Thurnham
page.content: Increasing numbers of birds are making this a Bird Watcher's paradise. Ring Plovers nest on stoney beaches, oyster catchers on fields and saltmarsh and shelducks in rabbit holes. Many different species including Herons, Comorants, Waders, Divers, Lapwings, Wheatear Owls and Field Fare. Hedges and dykes (ditches) provide a habitat for nesting, and the salt marsh and shingle are a rich source of food and habitat. There is a bird sanctuary at Plover Scar. Wild fowlers have shooting rights on the adjacent area.
